title: What It Took for Me to Finally Stop Hating Track Workouts
text:
What It Took for Me to Finally Stop Hating Track Workouts After many loops and miles, the writer starts to appreciate the track. By Ted Spiker Wednesday, March 29, 2017, 8:44 am Michael Coghlan VIA FLICKR AND LICENSED UNDER CREATIVE COMMONS ATTRIBUTION (CC BY) 2.0 LICENSE 
I hate the track. I hate the track. 
I avoid the track because I hate the track. Advertisement

The track works, they say. The track scolds you and coaxes you and inspires you. The track is where legs and lungs are are made stronger for the long haul. 
The track is where lunches are lost, I say. Slow, fast, slow, fast, no, yes, no, yes. 
100, 200, 400, 600, 800, 1200, 1600. Mix them up any way, like lottery numbers, and create your own workouts. 
Fine. 
RELATED: 5 Speed Workouts Every New Runner Should Try 
But I’ll still hate the track. 
In the darkness of morning and the quietness of a still-sleeping campus, one runner loops the 8th lane, then the 7th, then the 6th in a workout that he does week after week. His steady pace is quicker than my fast one. Noticing this makes me realize it’s why I’m here. 
The rule of the oval is that there are no bailouts. You map your plan, your times, and you stick to them. No matter what. 
No matter how you feel. No matter what miles you did yesterday. No matter if lane 1 has puddles or boogers or other runners. No matter what. That’s why the track works, they say. 
Fine. Go. 
Damn. Feel like an Amtrak, look like a tugboat. 
First week, ugh. Second week, less ugh. Third week, okay. Fourth week try to channel those who run on this oval at top speeds. Make the last one the best one, they say. 
#LastOneBestOne , they tweet. Last one best one is where they grow. 
Go x9. Three more. Last three best three, I say. Nail it on 10. Nail it on 11. Last one left. No bailouts. 
Fine. Go. 
Last one best one, I crush. 
Trash can on the sidelines, I want. 
Cooldown trot, I smile. 
I less-hate the track. I less-hate the track. 
* * * 
Ted Spiker’s preferred oval is a hoagie roll. You can follow him on Twitter , Instagram , and Snapchat at @ProfSpiker.
